title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships, scoring four goals and six points in seven games.
Locmelis aims to join the Bruins' roster, having excelled with 33 points for UMass and 12 points for the Providence Bruins.
Providence head coach Ryan Mougenel praised Locmelis for his quick adaptation to the AHL and his potential future impact.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for looking 'timid' in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye completed 14 of 20 passes for 150 yards and a touchdown by halftime but struggled in the second half.
Gronkowski emphasized the need for Maye to be more assertive as Patriots prepare to face the Dolphins.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died following injuries from an e-bike collision in Copley Square on August 6.
The incident occurred near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street in front of the Boston Public Library.
The e-bike operator remained at the scene, and no charges have been filed, according to police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston will experience noticeable king tides this fall due to the moon's perigean phases.
King tides occur when the moon, Earth, and Sun align, causing tides up to four feet higher than normal.
The Stone Living Lab on Boston Harbor will host high tide events starting September 11 at Long Wharf.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards with one touchdown and one interception against the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs supports Maye's ability to handle criticism, urging an open dialogue between the quarterback and receiver.
Diggs debuts with the Patriots, catching six passes for 57 yards, after returning from last season's ACL injury.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State audit reveals DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports between 2020 and 2023.
Communication breakdown between DESE and DCF lasted 41 months, affecting child abuse investigation processes.
DESE delayed addressing special education complaints and failed to support LGBTQ student initiatives.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was killed during a political event at Utah Valley University on September 10, 2025.
Massachusetts politicians condemned the shooting and called for an end to political violence in statements on social media.
Authorities arrested and released a person in connection with the shooting; no further suspects are identified by the FBI.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez remains sidelined from practice due to a hamstring injury since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses also absent from practice; Landry with a foot injury and Moses with a foot issue.
Gonzalez's absence impacts Patriots' defense ahead of Week 2 matchup against Dolphins at Hard Rock Stadium.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye expressed regret over missed throws during Patriots' loss to Raiders, including a crucial third-quarter interception.
Maye finished the game 30-for-46 for 287 yards, with a touchdown throw to DeMario Douglas in the red zone.
Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting only 1-of-3 opportunities, compared to Raiders' single successful red zone attempt.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown addressed rumors about playing for the Atlanta Hawks but emphasized his commitment to the Boston Celtics.
Brown has a four-year contract with Boston, having signed a $304 million supermax extension in July 2023.
As the 2024 NBA Finals MVP, Brown expects to lead the Celtics amid player changes and Jayson Tatum's injury.
